clinical_study.brief_title: Comparative Evaluation of the Efficacy of Intraoral Cryotherapy Versus Intracanal Cryotherapy on Postoperative Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Comparative Evaluation of the Efficacy of Intraoral Cryotherapy Versus Intracanal Cryotherapy on Postoperative Pain in Lower Molar Teeth With Irreversible Pulpitis and Symptomatic Apical Periodontitis Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to clinically compare the efficacy of intraoral cryotherapy versus intracanal cryotherapy after single visit root canal therapy in lower molars with irreversible pulpitis and symptomatic apical periodontitis

primary_outcome.measure: Postoperative pain assessed using Visual Analogue scale
primary_outcome.description: Intensity of pain after root canal treatment will be recorded by the patient where "0= no pain, 1-3= mild pain, 4-6= moderate pain, 7-10= severe pain."

primary_outcome.measure: Postoperative pain assessed using Visual Analogue scale
primary_outcome.description: Intensity of pain after root canal treatment will be recorded by the patient where "0= no pain, 1-3= mild pain, 4-6= moderate pain, 7-10= severe pain."

primary_outcome.measure: Postoperative pain assessed using Visual Analogue scale
primary_outcome.description: Intensity of pain after root canal treatment will be recorded by the patient where "0= no pain, 1-3= mild pain, 4-6= moderate pain, 7-10= severe pain."

secondary_outcome.measure: Postoperative pain assessed using Visual Analogue scale
secondary_outcome.description: Intensity of pain after root canal treatment will be recorded by the patient where "0= no pain, 1-3= mild pain, 4-6= moderate pain, 7-10= severe pain."

secondary_outcome.measure: Postoperative pain assessed using Visual Analogue scale
secondary_outcome.description: Intensity of pain after root canal treatment will be recorded by the patient where "0= no pain, 1-3= mild pain, 4-6= moderate pain, 7-10= severe pain."

other_outcome.measure: Number of analgesics taken by the patient
other_outcome.description: Number of analgesics taken by the patient after endodontic treatment.

intervention.description: small ice packs wrapped in sterile gauze placed in the mouth on the vestibular surface of the treated tooth
Intracanal cryotherapy technique using 2.5Â°C cold saline irrigation as final irrigant

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Systemically healthy patient (ASA I or II).
Mandibular first molar teeth with:
- Preoperative sharp pain and symptomatic apical periodontitis
- Absence or slight widening in the periodontal ligament (PDL).
- Vital response of pulp tissue to cold pulp tester (ethyl chloride spray) .
- Positive response to percussion test
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Medically compromised patients.
2. Pregnant women.
3. Patients reporting bruxism or clenching.
4. Patients allergic to ciprofloxacin or metronidazole.
5. Teeth associated with acute periapical abscess and/or swelling.
6. Greater than grade I mobility or pocket depth greater than 5mm.
7. Size of periapical radiolucency is greater than 8 mm.
8. No restorability: Hopeless tooth.
9. Immature teeth.
10. Radiographic evidence of external or internal root resorption vertical root fracture, perforation, calcification.

reference.citation: Fayyad DM, Abdelsalam N, Hashem N. Cryotherapy: A New Paradigm of Treatment in Endodontics. J Endod. 2020 Jul;46(7):936-942. doi: 10.1016/j.joen.2020.03.019. Epub 2020 May 6. Review.

Gundogdu EC, Arslan H. Effects of Various Cryotherapy Applications on Postoperative Pain in Molar Teeth with Symptomatic Apical Periodontitis: A Preliminary Randomized Prospective Clinical Trial. J Endod. 2018 Mar;44(3):349-354. doi: 10.1016/j.joen.2017.11.002. Epub 2018 Feb 3.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Principal investigator, Resident at faculty of dentistry, Cairo University
